intro: Crotalaria sulphizii, commonly known as the sulfurleaf cowpea, is a flowering plant in the legume family Fabaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has a bushy, upright habit. Its seeds are encased in a hard pod and are used as a protein source in some regions. The plant is also known for its medicinal properties and has been studied for potential use in traditional medicine.
